DOC.brief_title: Optimal Insulin Correction Factor Post- High Intensity Exercise Hyperglycemia Adults With Type 1 Diabetes ( FIT )
DOC.detailed_description: FIT open-label , repeat measure cross-over study . The overall objective study investigate glycemic response 0 % , 50 % , 100 % 150 % bolus insulin correction ( base personal insulin correction factor ) post-exercise hyperglycemia physically active adult type 1 diabetes ( T1D ) use multiple daily injection ( MDI ) control , clinically representative , experimental setting . Following 2 week screen phase , patient enter 8 week transition insulin glargine U300 ( Toujeo® ) another basal insulin , order optimize insulin dose determine individual insulin correction factor . The final phase study intervention phase , consist 4 separate visit . At visit , patient perform 15 minute high intensity exercise morning . If become hyperglycemic following exercise ( blood glucose > 8.0 mmol/L ) , receive one four insulin correction dos ( 0 % 50 % , 100 % , 150 % usual correction factor ) randomize order . They monitor clinical pharmacology unit study staff rest day overnight . The patient wear continuous glucose monitor ( CGM ) intervention visit . The primary outcome study great net reduction plasma glucose ( YSI ) follow 50 % , 100 % 150 % bolus insulin correction post-exercise hyperglycemia , compare bolus insulin correction . Key secondary outcome include mean time spend post-exercise hyperglycemia ( > 8.0 mmol/L ) , post-exercise euglycemia ( 4.0-8.0 mmol/L ) post-exercise hypoglycaemia ( ≤ 3.9 mmol/L ) within 180 minute 24 hour follow bolus insulin correction .
